document_data.name: Feeblemind
document_data.mainbody: '''''Feeblemind''''' was a powerful [[enchantment]] [[spell]] that reduced a person's intelligence and personality to almost nothing.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.wizards.com/default.asp?x=dnd/list/spells|title=SpellIndex|author=|date=2005-12-19|work=Consolidated Lists|publisher=[[Wizards of the Coast]]|accessdate=2007-06-10}}
document_data.Effects: Arcane [[spellcaster]]s were quite vulnerable to the effects of this spell, which were hard to remove.
document_data.History:
The [[Netherese]] [[arcanist]] [[Hamring]] was given the credit for the creation of this spell in {{Yearlink|-1293}}, which was then known as '''''Hamring's feeblemind'''''.

In [[1357 DR]] evil wizard [[Cassana]] placed a permanent version of this spell on the cell containing [[Finder Wyvernspur]], rendering him mad and unable to escape.

''Feeblemind'' was a common spell in the Realms after [[1358 DR]].
